Package api

Class DWGraph_Algo

java.lang.Object
api.DWGraph_Algo
All Implemented Interfaces:
dw_graph_algorithms, java.io.Serializable
public class DWGraph_Algo
extends java.lang.Object
implements dw_graph_algorithms, java.io.Serializable
This class creates a graph and includes algorithms: One copies, the other checks if the graph is connected How long it takes to get from one vertex to another What is the shortest path from one vertex to another Saves the graph to the given file name Loads a graph to graph algorithm
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes 
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    static class  DWGraph_Algo.myWay
    This class represents a support object for the "shortestPath" method, at the "shortestPathDist" method the graph is tested to find the shortest path between vertices.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    DWGraph_Algo()
    A default constructor

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    directed_weighted_graph copy()
    Builds a deep copy of the received graph, By calling the DWGraph_DS copy constructor.
    directed_weighted_graph getGraph()
    Return the underlying graph of which this class works.
    void init​(directed_weighted_graph g)
    This function preforms a shallow copy (creates another pointer for the graph)
    boolean isConnected()
    This function checks if the graph is connected by checking if there is a path from any vertex in the graph to any other vertex in the graph (Dijkstra algorithm)
    boolean load​(java.lang.String file)
    This function loads a graph to graph algorithm from JSON format file.
    boolean save​(java.lang.String file)
    This function saves the directed weighted graph to the given file name - in JSON format
    java.util.List<node_data> shortestPath​(int src, int dest)
    This function returns the shortest path between src to dest - as an ordered List of nodes: src--> n1-->n2-->...dest, by using the function "shortestPathDist" map that was created in the function.
    double shortestPathDist​(int src, int dest)
    This function returns the length of the shortest path between two vertexes on the graph by checking all the graph vertexes edges and its neighbors edges by pushing them to a priority queue (Dijkstra algorithm)

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • isConnected

      public boolean isConnected()
      This function checks if the graph is connected by checking if there is a path from any vertex in the graph to any other vertex in the graph (Dijkstra algorithm)
      Specified by:

    • shortestPathDist

      public double shortestPathDist​(int src, int dest)
      This function returns the length of the shortest path between two vertexes on the graph by checking all the graph vertexes edges and its neighbors edges by pushing them to a priority queue (Dijkstra algorithm)
      Specified by:
      shortestPathDist in interface dw_graph_algorithms
      Parameters:
      src - - start node
      dest - - end (target) node
      Returns:

    • shortestPath

      public java.util.List<node_data> shortestPath​(int src, int dest)
      This function returns the shortest path between src to dest - as an ordered List of nodes: src--> n1-->n2-->...dest, by using the function "shortestPathDist" map that was created in the function.
      Specified by:
      shortestPath in interface dw_graph_algorithms
      Parameters:
      src - - start node
      dest - - end (target) node
      Returns:

    • save

      public boolean save​(java.lang.String file)
      This function saves the directed weighted graph to the given file name - in JSON format
      Specified by:
      save in interface dw_graph_algorithms
      Parameters:
      file - - the file name .
      Returns:
      true - iff the file was successfully saved

    • load

      public boolean load​(java.lang.String file)
      This function loads a graph to graph algorithm from JSON format file. If the file was successfully loaded - the graph will be changed, If graph was not loaded the original graph should remain "as is".
      Specified by:
      load in interface dw_graph_algorithms
      Parameters:
      file - - file name
      Returns:
      true - if the graph was successfully loaded.
